title: Why Manchester United have Chile legend Marcelo Salas to thank for landing Cristiano Ronaldo in 2003
text:
Sport Why Manchester United have Chile legend Marcelo Salas to thank for landing Cristiano Ronaldo in 2003 The Red Devils snapped up an 18-year-old Ronaldo in 2003 - but it could have all been so different Share Manchester United almost missed out on Ronaldo (Photo: Getty) Share Get Manchester United FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
The inside story of Cristiano Ronaldo's Â£12million transfer to Manchester United in 2003 is very well known. 
The Red Devils were facing off against Sporting Lisbon in a pre-season friendly in Portugal and after an 18-year-old Ronaldo left John O'Shea all ends up, Sir Alex Ferguson spoke to the teenager and told him he wanted to snap him up then and there. 
But it could have all be oh-so different. 
Former Juventus sporting director Gianni Di Marzio has revealed that the Portguese star almost made the move to Italy a year earlier - only for Chilean striker Marcelo Salas to scupper the move. One of these 2003 Manchester United signings panned out better than the other (Photo: PA) 
Di Marzio agreed a swap deal which would have seen Ronaldo and Salas swap places, but the Chilean would not agree to the terms of the deal. 
The move mooted deal initially came about after Di Marzio went to Lisbon to scout Ricardo Quaresma, but he did not play in the clash against Belenenses. Salas dug his heels in at Juve (Photo: Reuters) Read More 
In his place was a fresh-faced Ronaldo, who gave an early display of the talents that would one day win him the Ballon d'Or in just his third appearance for the club. 
"He was eighteen when I worked at Juventus," Di Marzio told Marca . Salas formed a superb partnership with Ivan Zamorano for Chile (Photo: Getty Images Europe)

"I called my club and told them I'd seen someone who would be the best player in the world, obviously after Maradona. 
"I negotiated and brought Cristiano over to Turin in 2002 to sign for Juve, but Salas didn't accept the terms of the swap. 
"For just a few million euros, Salas didn't want to leave and so Juventus lost out on Cristiano Ronaldo. His agent [Jorge Mendes] knows this story very well."
